item.title: Grit & Valor: 1949 ‘Boss Fight: General Harmsworth’ trailer, PC closed beta test begins December 2
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/grit-valor-1949-boss-fight-general-harmsworth-trailer-pc-closed-beta-test-begins-december-2

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Applications available now.

Publisher Megabit and developer Aonic have released a new trailer for dieselpunk roguelite real-time strategy game Grit & Valor: 1949 introducing one of the game’s boss encounters, as well as announced that a closed beta test will begin on December 2 for PC via Steam. Sign-ups are available here.

“Region bosses add a whole new level of strategy to each run,” developer Aonic explained in a press release. “If players manage to reach the end of a run, they’ll need to make one last stand against a menacing Axis General and their gargantuan mechs. These end of Region boss battles will have you facing overwhelming odds, wave upon wave of elite enemies, new hazards, and Kaiju-sized Boss Mechs.”

Grit & Valor: 1949 is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2025.

Watch the trailer below. View the screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Botany Manor coming to PS5, PS4 on December 17
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/botany-manor-coming-to-ps5-ps4-on-december-17

  • PS4
  • PS5

Currently available for Xbox Series, Xbox One, Switch, and PC.

Publisher Whitethorn Games and developer Balloon Studios will release botanical puzzle game Botany Manor for PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 on December 17, the companies announced.

Botany Manor first launched for Xbox Series, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on April 9. It is also available via Game Pass.

Here is an overview of the game, via Whitethorn Games:

About

Botany Manor is a botanical puzzle game set in a historical English homestead brimming with a lifetime of memorabilia and research to explore, where players will uncover long-forgotten seeds and piece together clues as they solve puzzles to help each rare plant grow.

The enduring estate of Botany Manor is home to retired botanist Arabella Greene. After a long career, she has amassed a collection of rare, long-forgotten plants that require some research to help them live again. Play as Arabella and explore the stunning historic manor and its grounds to look for clues in her notes, books, posters, and items scattered around the residence to determine the correct set of circumstances to help the flora flourish. Unlock new seeds and plant them. Interactable items around the property that can be turned and flipped will provide information to help you solve each gardening puzzle, grow the plants, and discover their mysterious qualities.

Key Features

  • Explore the peaceful grounds and many calming rooms of the beautifully rendered, historically accurate 19th century manor.
  • Pick up, flip, turn, and rotate the many items found around the estate to piece together the clues to solve each plant-based puzzle.
  • Learn about Arabella’s life, career, and the challenges she faced as a woman scientist during the 19th century as you explore.
  • Fall in love with the calming soundtrack that perfectly compliments the environment and flowers you bring to full bloom.

item.title: Forever Skies PS5 demo now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/forever-skies-ps5-demo-now-available

  • PS5

Play the demo to unlock a special in-game reward.

A demo for science-fiction first-person survival game Forever Skies is now available for PlayStation 5 via PlayStation Store, developer Far From Home announced.

Forever Skies is currently in Early Access for PC via Steam, where it launched on June 22, 2023. A full release is planned for PlayStation 5 and PC in early 2025.

Here is an overview of the demo, via PlayStation Store:

Experience the beginning of a science-fiction survival adventure set in the skies of a post-apocalyptic Earth. Build and pilot your high-tech airship, scavenge for supplies, research new technology, and survive in this hostile world. The full game will include a cooperative (up to four players), story, multiple locations and biomes, combat, advanced airship building, a pet companion, and exploring the toxic surface of the Earth. Play the demo to unlock a special in-game reward!
